metadata.subject: J.P. Morgan exclusive conference call on Thursday, November 8th at 4pm EST: "Post-election insight: The road ahead"

organizations: U.S. Senate Committee on Environment and Public Works
Brookings-JP Morgan Chase Global Cities Initiative
Atlantic Council of the United States
Center for Strategic and International Studies

relationships.description: Executive Vice President and Head of Corporate Responsibility
Former U.S. Special Trade Negotiator and Ambassador
Former Chief of Staff to Senator Max Baucus
Private banking services for wealthy clients

analysis.purpose: To invite clients to an exclusive conference call analyzing post-election implications for financial markets
analysis.significance: Shows J.P. Morgan providing political analysis to wealthy clients following the 2012 presidential election

notable_quotes: Peter is an undisputed expert in political matters, having spent nearly a decade in government service as U.S. Special Trade Negotiator and Ambassador in the Clinton administrations.
This call is for educational purposes only. JPMC does not endorse any candidate or political party. It is not permissible to forward this information to anyone else.
red_flags: Exclusive access to political analysis for wealthy clients

blackmail_indicators.description: Standard business communication with no indicators of coercion or blackmail

illegal_activity.description: Legitimate business communication about a financial services conference call

public_knowledge.context: Standard financial industry practice of providing political analysis to clients

analysis.summary: J.P. Morgan Private Bank is inviting clients to an exclusive conference call featuring Peter Scher, a former Clinton administration trade official, to discuss the implications of the 2012 election results on financial markets and regulatory policy, particularly focusing on the fiscal cliff and global economic impacts.
